title: 'A self-inflicted wound': Why Ole Miss finally had enough of Lane Kiffin

title: A final farewell to Lane Kiffin and the rest of the Bottom 10
content: With the season over and the final votes tallied, we crown the best of the worst -- on and off the field.

title: Giannis exits with right calf strain, will have MRI
content: Bucks star Giannis Antetokounmpo was sent for an MRI after suffering a right calf strain Wednesday night against the Pistons, but head coach Doc Rivers said the Bucks have ruled out the possibility of an Achilles injury.

title: AD disputes Kiffin's version of exit from Ole Miss
content: Ole Miss athletic director Keith Carter is disputing Lane Kiffin's version of events surrounding the coach's controversial exit for LSU.

title: Siena lacrosse coach Gleason, 41, dies after fall
content: Siena men's lacrosse coach Liam Gleason has died, the school announced Wednesday, three days after he suffered a traumatic brain injury in a fall at his home. He was 41.

title: Harden 'just as shocked as you guys' by CP3 news
content: Clippers stars Kawhi Leonard and James Harden said Wednesday night they were both "shocked" when they learned earlier that morning Chris Paul would no longer be their teammate.

title: Nuggets' Murray lethal from 3, pours in 52 points
content: Jamal Murray scored a season-high 52 points, going 19-of-25 from the field and even better from 3-point range (10-of-11) as Denver toppled Indiana 135-120.

title: 'All-time Raven' Andrews secures 3-year extension
content: The Ravens rewarded Mark Andrews with a three-year, $39.3 million extension, locking in the franchise leader in receptions, receiving yards and TD catches.

title: Chargers' Herbert (hand) preparing to play MNF
content: Chargers quarterback Justin Herbert, who recently had surgery on his fractured left hand, said Wednesday he is preparing to play Monday night against the Eagles.

title: Brady, Shaq top A-list of assistants for WC draw
content: Tom Brady and Shaquille O'Neal are two of the headliners who will assist with Friday's World Cup draw in Washington, D.C., FIFA announced on Wednesday.

title: What now for Chris Paul and the Clippers? We answered six questions on the stunning news
content: What's next for Chris Paul? What about the Clippers, who are struggling badly? We answered five questions about this big roster shake-up.

content: The FIFA World Cup draw is happening Friday, and 42 of the 48 teams are confirmed. But what's one thing you need to know about each nation?

content: Many star volleyball players are wearing a hair-tie solution invented by three-time champion Jerritt Elliott.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Crystal Palace open to offers for Mateta
content: Will Jean-Philippe Mateta leave Crystal Palace in January? Transfer Talk has the latest news and rumors.

title: Vancouver isn't built around its star, and Müller & Co. are better for it
content: Instead of building the plane around Thomas Müller, the Vancouver Whitecaps asked the Germany legend to fit around their structure -- and it has worked.

title: Why Chelsea believe young star Estêvão is destined for greatness
content: Estêvão has shown his extraordinary talent, but Chelsea have been carefully managing his development.

title: 'I do record everything': The told and untold stories of Merab Dvalishvili
content: Dvalishvili, the UFC champion Dana White once called "next-level stupid," is slowly taking over the internet.

title: F1 finale: History haunts McLaren, beckons for Verstappen
content: At F1's season finale, McLaren's parallels to past heartbreaks are hard to ignore as Max Verstappen's long-shot title bid doesn't look so far fetched.

title: Fast break: LeBron experiences a career first, Edey emerging as a must-add
content: Eric Moody's looks at the evolution of LeBron James' game, the emergence of Zach Edey, Jay Huff's upside and more.

title: State must not prosecute citizens without reasonable prospect of conviction: Supreme Court judgment
content: Such prosecutions violate citizens' right to fair process and burdens judicial system already weighed down by "massive backlog", Supreme Court notes

title: India-Russia ties direct outcome of Indo-Soviet partnership cemented in 1955: Congress
content: The Bulganin-Khrushchev visit established the foundations of close Indo-Soviet collaboration of which the Bhilai Steel Plant and IIT Bombay were only two of the early examples, Jairam Ramesh said

title: Customs foils alleged bid to smuggle 11 endangered birds at Kochi airport in Kerala
content: According to Customs, the birds were seized from baggage of a Malappuram family who arrived from Thailand. The family was intercepted based on suspicion

title: What do ‘Stranger Things’, John Lennon and Malayalis have in common
content: Kerala Tourism’s social media account connects global cultural icons to the state’s culture, art, heritage, and experiences

title: MoU signed to expand services for children with developmental disabilities
content: The organisations will collaborate on early identification and intervention, capacity building for professionals and caregivers, joint research activities and initiatives aimed at improving community awareness and inclusion

title: SC hearing on SIR LIVE updates: SC to continue hearing pleas challenging ECI revision of voter rolls in Bengal, Tamil Nadu
content: Supreme Court hears arguments that the Special Intensive Revision allows mass scrutiny of citizenship based on mere suspicion, posing threats of disenfranchisement and statelessness

title: India, Russia Defence Ministers to Co-Chair 22nd Commission Meet in Delhi
content: The two leaders will review the entire range of multi-faceted relations between the two countries in the field of defence, including Military and Military Technical Cooperation

title: KSRTC disburses ₹4.38 crore compensation to dependants of employees, launches new commercial management software e-Vaneejya
content: Under the Saarige Suraksha Accident Insurance Scheme, cheques of ₹1 crore each were handed over to the families of three employees who died due to off-duty accidents and electrocution

title: Putin's India visit LIVE: Russian President to meet PM Modi today
content: The Russian President is likely to arrive in New Delhi at around 4:30 p.m. on Thursday (December 4, 2025) on his first visit to India in 4 years.

title: Kerala local body polls: Triangular contest shapes Kasaragod’s high-stakes elections
content: The district’s multifaceted politics has ensured that all three fronts wield notable influence despite the NDA’s lack of representation in the Assembly and Parliament

title: Congress in the grip of a mafia-like gang: Binoy Viswam
content: CPI State secretary says if voters choose to evaluate the government’s performance and vote accordingly, they are not going to reject us

title: Kerala local body polls: A litmus test for BJP as NDA targets 25% vote share in local body polls
content: This election will test whether BJP can successfully transition from being a peripheral player to a formidable third front in Kerala politics.  Party has mounted an unprecedented campaign, employing a mixed strategy of urban targeting and intensified community outreach with an eye on the Assembly polls next year

title: 68 IndiGo flight cancellations plunge Hyderabad airport into chaos for second day in row
content: Travellers complained that they were left without reliable information on revised timings and were unsure about alternative arrangements

title: After pounding north Tamil Nadu, remnant of Cyclone Ditwah drifts inland; city to get light rain today
content: Water discharge from Red Hills reservoir, a key drinking water source of Chennai, increased on Wednesday evening as its storage touched 96% of its capacity

title: Putin’s India visit: A tense tightrope walk for Modi government
content: Everything from the optics of the visit, to agreements on oil, trade, defence, nuclear cooperation, and labour mobility have consequences for India’s ties with the U,S, and E.U.

title: Law graduates seek judicial intervention over bar exam irregularities in Maharashtra
content: Law graduates say AIBE-XX exam chaos in Maharashtra undermines dignity, equality, and credibility of legal profession

title: Haryana CM Saini hits out at Mamata-led TMC government in Bengal; says ‘targeting’ Hindus
content: CM Saini said that despite West Bengal having a woman Chief Minister, the condition of women in the state was suffering and their situation was deteriorating

title: Countries creating roadblocks in flow of talents across borders will be 'net losers': Jaishankar on issues linked to immigration, H-1B visas
content: The External Affairs Minister also highlighted how the government has been trying to address the problems of Indians living abroad.

title: Tamil Nadu Senior Advocates Forum questions parliamentary trend of bypassing High Courts
content: First Division Bench of Chief Justice Manindra Mohan Shrivastava and Justice G. Arul Murugan on Wednesday called for a counter affidavit by the Centre within three weeks

title: ‘No proposal to revise OBC creamy layer income limit’
content: Responding to a query raised by Rajya Sabha MP Salma, Mr. Verma said that the revision of income limit is done on an ongoing basis from time to time.

title: Players' complaints on 'outdated and dictatorial' coaching style led to Harendra's resignation
content: Harendra Singh, who joined the team in April 2024, surprised the fraternity by resigning as head coach on December 1

title: Mandaviya promises end to Indian football ‘stalemate’
content: An official, who attended the meeting, said the Minister started by asking how Indian football ended up in such a mess, a question which did not fetch any clear answers from those present

title: Orissa High Court refuses to interfere in petitions seeking reservation in medical super specialty posts
content: Adjudicating petitions filed by two candidates belonging to reserved categories, Orissa High Court Judge Biraja Prasanna Satpathy said the court found no illegality in the advertisement issued by State government

title: Mamata tries to allay fears of over implementation of Waqf Amendment Bill
content: The Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee’s remarks come days after a letter by West Bengal Minority Affairs Department directed all District Magistrates to upload registered Waqf Properties on Data in Unified Waqf Management, Empowerment

title: South Indians don't want to be isolated because they don't know Hindi: Supreme Court judge B.V. Nagarathna
content: Justice Nagarathna said there are so many languages in the 8th Schedule of the Constitution, and in South India, there are at least six languages.

title: Law Commission to brief joint committee of Parliament on simultaneous polls on December 4
content: In a brief opinion rendered to the joint committee on November 28, the law panel said the bill falls under Parliament's power to make laws which does not entail ratification by States.

title: Congress dismisses rumours of Hemant Soren-BJP likely tie-up; says INDIA bloc in Jharkhand is rock solid
content: Speculation in the political circles of Jharkhand was that Chief Minister Hemant Soren and his wife, Kalpana Soren, had recently visited Delhi and met with some top BJP leaders and engaged in talks with the likely shift of power in the State

title: BJP slams SP MP for saying that Muslims may have to wage ‘jihad’ to fight government oppression
content: Speaking in the Lok Sabha against the Waqf Amendment Bill, Rampur MP Mohibbullah Nadvi says government is undermining Articles 25 and 26 of the Constitution; BJP says his remarks “inciting unrest”

title: Nepal, India to discuss supply of aviation fuel through pipeline
content: Officials from the two countries are set to hold a meeting next week in New Delhi, said an official at the Ministry of Commerce and Industry

title: Haryana man fails to pay ₹1 cr. for ‘fancy number’; Minister orders income check
content: Last week, during an online auction for the registration number HR-88-B-8888 in the Badhra subdivision of Charkhi Dadri district, the man was declared the successful bidder

title: Do not comment on order you haven't challenged: Pune court to Rahul Gandhi
content: Judge Shinde concurred that Rahul Gandhi’s application raised doubts about the functioning of the court

title: Poll preparations intensify in Ernakulam as officials balance SIR and election duties
content: Election-related work, which began in July, reached a crucial stage with the commissioning of EVMs on Wednesday; ‘nearly 30 officials from various departments at civil station are handling responsibilities almost round the clock’

title: UDF’s manifesto for Ernakulam district gives thrust to tourism, waste management, public transport
content: The manifesto outlines plans for modern technologies in waste treatment, a mobility hub in Kakkanad, tourism fairs and food fests, and new health and welfare initiatives in panchayats

title: GRP head constable assaults disabled youth at M.P. railway station
content: A video posted on X shows the head constable dragging, pushing, and kicking the youth, allegedly for sitting on the floor of the platform at Nagda junction; constable later suspended by the GRP SP, Indore

title: Labour codes likely to be fully operational from April 1, 2026, Govt to pre-publish draft rules soon
content: Since labour is a concurrent subject, appropriate governments — Centre and States — will have to notify the rules under the four codes to enforce these fully across the country

title: PM asks BJP MPs from West Bengal to keep SIR ‘straightforward’
content: PM asks MPs not to let the ongoing SIR become a subject of controversy in the State, where the BJP is the main Oppposition party; asks them to focus on ground level work ahead of next year’s polls

title: Prohibitory orders clamped in Tirupparankundram, litigants not allowed to light lamp at pillar
content: High drama continued till 9 p.m. when armed with an order passed by the judge in a contempt of court case, the litigant and members of Hindu organisations, accompanied by CISF personnel from the High Court, arrived to go atop the hill to light the lamp

title: Entrepreneurs seek a roadmap for promoting ecotourism spots in Kozhikode
content: They say projects that focus on sustainable livelihood schemes should be implemented, and that it should be taken up as a major campaign agenda during local body polls

title: Naidu announces free transport for all differently-abled people in APSRTC buses
content: Differently-abled people will be nominated as ex-officio members in every government body and people’s representative institutions, says Naidu

title: LDF promises  ‘professional makeover’ in running of Thiruvananthapuram Corporation
content: Front’s manifesto  for Thiruvananthapuram Corporation makes a host of promises under the broad tagline of ‘Capital City, Happiness City.’ On waste management, it lays stress on waste treatment at source for households, while a centralised treatment plant using Biomethanation will be set up to treat bio waste from bulk waste generators

title: States will have to abide by terms of Samagra Shiksha to receive funds: Pradhan
content: The Education Minister was responding to a question from Rajya Sabha MP John Brittas regarding the reasons for withholding or delaying the release of the central share

title: Ready to release Samagra Shiksha funds to Kerala subject to NEP implementation: Union Minister
content: John Brittas, MP, seeks release of remaining Samagra Shiksha funds sanctioned to Kerala during 2025-26

title: Prasar Bharati Chairman Navneet Kumar Sehgal resigns
content: The retired IAS officer of the U.P. cadre was appointed to head India’s public service broadcaster in March 2024

title: Natural farming addresses challenges in agricultural sector: PM Modi
content: “Over the past few decades, the rising dependence on chemical fertilizers and pesticides has affected soil fertility, moisture and long-term sustainability,” says the Prime Minister

title: Nagaur MP demands safe return of 61 Indians trapped in Russia-Ukraine war ahead of Putin’s visit
content: Beniwal raised the issue during Zero Hour in Lok Sabha; the MEA has said that it has taken up the matter with Russian authorities, both in Delhi and Moscow

title: OMR barely passable; potholes slow down traffic
content: Traffic is slow, causing stress to motorists who also face hardships due to who are already getting bad backs potholes that have appeared on recently-laid surfaces.

title: FedEx opens 60,000 sq.ft air hub at Kempegowda International Airport
content: The facility incorporates multiple conveyors and a throughput capacity of nearly 4,000 packages per hour

title: Organisers of Bhopal gas tragedy anniversary rally booked as effigy resembles ‘RSS worker’
content: Two effigies were seen in the rally — one portraying the U.S.-based Dow Chemical, and other of a man in white shirt and khaki half-pants

title: Academics protest against Bill to revamp Indian Statistical Institute
content: The historic institute, founded by P.C. Mahalanobis, is considered the gold standard of statistical research in India; the Bill will significantly alter the functioning of the institute ‘severely stripping it of its academic autonomy’, the petitioners said in an appeal to the Union Ministry of Statistics and Implementation

title: Jobs alert: Slovakian companies demand skilled manpower from Karnataka
content: Global automaker Stellantis, which is the manufacturer of Citroën C3, C3 Aircross, and Opel Frontera models, is seeking candidates with advanced automobile electrical skills

title: Safeguarding India-Russia ties from Trump pressure is top priority for Putin, says Russian analyst
content: As the Russian President arrives in Delhi for talks, top Russian analyst says India is a “pragmatist” that will not give up profits earned from Russian crude purchases; India, Russia likely to sign deal on worker mobility

title: Uphaar fire tragedy: Delhi court frames charges against convict Sushil Ansal in passport case
content: The court said Ansal "has consciously concealed the details of criminal cases pending against him as also the order of conviction" in the sworn declaration submitted with his 2013 Tatkaal passport application

title: India committed to the idea of oceans remaining open, stable and rules-based: President Droupadi Murmu
content: Various platforms of the Navy, including the aircraft carrier INS Vikrant, destroyers, frigates, the attack submarine INS Shishumar, and the sailships INS Sudarshini and INS Tarangini, give an over-three-hour demonstration at the Operational Demo organised at Shanghumugham

title: Centre betraying Bahujans through its approach on caste census, says Rahul Gandhi
content: Congress Deputy Leader Gaurav Gogoi spoke of the circumstances around the death of Zubeen Garg, demands justice

title: Centre evasive on delay in appointments to National Commission for Minorities
content: Over a month after the Delhi High Court sought a response on long-pending vacancies, the Minority Affairs Ministry offers no timeline for filling posts in the NCM

title: Man held on charge of murder in Ernakulam
content: The police grew suspicious after the post-mortem revealed severe injuries to the woman’s head and internal organs

title: Man-animal conflict frays India’s wildlife conservation ethos
content: Centre’s action plan seeks to address key drivers of conflict — habitat fragmentation, damaged corridors, and retaliatory killing — by promoting mitigation measures, data-driven monitoring, and stronger habitat protection

title: Missing public park: Madras High Court orders inquiry by Collector, Chennai Corporation
content: Chief Justice Manindra Mohan Shrivastava and Justice G. Arul Murugan say alleged encroachment of a public park by a private hospital is a serious issue

title: SC directs UPSC to deploy screen-reader software for visually impaired candidates, eases scribe change norms
content: Supreme Court mandated that every UPSC examination notification must include a clear provision permitting eligible candidates to request a change of scribe up to at least seven days before the examination

title: Gyanesh Kumar takes charge as head of International IDEA council
content: India’s chairmanship of the International IDEA council would be decisive, ambitious, and action-oriented, the Chief Election Commissioner said

title: Protest against coal mining turns violent in Chhattisgarh’s Surguja, police personnel injured
content: ‘Some villagers had received compensation for land acquisition, but many others refused to accept money and tried to obstruct mining operations,’ an official of the local administration said

title: Bengaluru techie's death note: How 'dream house' became trap for software professional
content: A Bengaluru techie tragically ended his life, citing relentless harassment from neighbours and civic officials over a Rs 20 lakh demand. Murali Govindaraju was found dead in his under-construction home, leaving a note detailing his torment. His neighbours have been arrested, accused of extorting money under the guise of activism, leading to this devastating outcome.

title: Putin’s India visit: Private dinner with PM Modi, Rajghat visit — what’s on itinerary
content: President Vladimir Putin arrives in India for a significant visit. He will meet Prime Minister Narendra Modi for private dinner diplomacy. Day two includes a Rajghat tribute and summit talks. Discussions will focus on strengthening economic ties, trade, and cooperation in technology and energy. Several bilateral agreements are expected to be signed, charting a roadmap for future collaboration until 2030.

title: 'Strategic mistake': IndiGo flight disruptions due to new roster rules? What DGCA norms say
content: India's largest airline, IndiGo, is facing significant flight disruptions, with hundreds of cancellations and delays due to new pilot rest and duty-hour regulations. Despite a month since implementation, the airline struggles to adapt, leading to a sharp drop in on-time performance. IndiGo cites operational challenges and expects disruptions to continue.

title: Razor-thin victories, key losses: Mixed signals for BJP & AAP in Delhi MCD bypoll results
content: MCD bypolls delivered mixed results for BJP and AAP, with both parties losing key strongholds. Several contests were decided by narrow margins, highlighting a shifting political landscape. The elections served as a crucial test for the BJP government, with public sentiment influencing outcomes in several wards.

title: Putin in Delhi today: How Russian president's visit sent five-star rates to dizzying heights
content: Russian President Vladimir Putin's visit to Delhi has significantly boosted occupancy and tariffs for the city's five-star hotels. Alongside major international events, the presidential suite at ITC Maurya is booked, with other top hotels also sold out. This surge in demand, driven by both official delegations and upcoming weddings, highlights the impact of large-scale events on the hospitality sector.

title: 'Cultural shift': Zoho's Vembu on US 'skip college' trend; why Indian parents should worry
content: Zoho founder Sridhar Vembu champions American tech's trend of high schoolers skipping college for work, urging Indian parents to recognize this "profound cultural shift." He highlights Palantir's experiment hiring graduates directly, emphasizing empowerment and avoiding student debt. Vembu advocates for companies to remove degree requirements, citing Zoho's success with young, degreeless talent.

title: IND vs SA: Kohli equals Tendulkar’s world record - full list of milestones set in Raipur
content: Run-machine Virat Kohli's brilliant 102 wasn't enough as South Africa chased down 359 in Raipur, levelling the three-match series 1-1.  Kohli's century, his 53rd ODI ton, saw him equal Sachin Tendulkar's record for hundreds at 34 venues.  Ruturaj Gaikwad also scored a century in their record partnership against the Proteas.

title: Why Hindi becomes a flashpoint on Mumbai locals? Teen's death sparks big political storm
content: A 19-year-old student's alleged suicide after being assaulted on a Mumbai local train for speaking Hindi has ignited a political firestorm. Tensions over language, exacerbated by crowded commutes and nativist politics, have boiled over on the city's suburban railway network, leading to a heated debate and protests.

title: SMAT: Rohit Sharma ready to play for Mumbai; knockouts from Dec 12-18
content: Rohit Sharma, despite retiring from T20 Internationals, has expressed his keenness to represent Mumbai in the upcoming Syed Mushtaq Ali Trophy knockouts.  The star batter, currently engaged in the ODI series against South Africa, could feature for Mumbai in the tournament's final stages. This move aligns with BCCI's mandate for Indian players to participate in domestic cricket when available.

title: OTT vs telcos: WhatsApp, Telegram upset with new rule; Airtel, Jio & Vi praise DoT
content: India's telecom and technology industry bodies are clashing over a new government mandate requiring SIM binding for OTT platforms. While telecom giants like Jio and Airtel welcome the move to curb fraud, tech firms represented by BIF express 'serious concerns' about jurisdiction, consumer impact, and technical feasibility, urging a pause and consultation.

title: Raj Nidimoru’s ex-wife pens a lengthy note after his and Samantha Ruth Prabhu’s wedding
content: Raj Nidimoru and Samantha Ruth Prabhu recently married at Isha Yoga Centre. Amidst congratulatory messages, attention turned to Raj's ex-wife, Shhyamali De. She shared a lengthy social media note expressing gratitude for well wishes while dealing with her Jyotish guru's Stage 4 cancer diagnosis.

title: H-1B visa row: US orders enhanced vetting for applicants — what are the new requirements?
content: The Trump administration has intensified H-1B visa vetting, scrutinizing applicants and their families for involvement in 'censorship' of free speech. This includes reviewing social media for content moderation or misinformation roles.  The move aims to prevent individuals deemed complicit in suppressing expression from entering the U.S., particularly those in tech.

title: Jeff Bezos' ex-wife cut her Amazon stake to donate millions of dollars
content: MacKenzie Scott, Jeff Bezos' ex-wife, has significantly reduced her Amazon stake, donating billions to diversity, equity, and inclusion initiatives. Her recent $80 million gift to Howard University highlights her focus on substantial contributions to DEI and disaster relief. Scott's philanthropic efforts continue to impact numerous causes, solidifying her position as a top global philanthropist.

title: When and where to watch the Geminids meteor shower 2025 peak nights
content: The Geminids meteor shower, a consistent and bright celestial event, is set for a spectacular display in 2025. With minimal moonlight during its peak on December 13-14, stargazers can anticipate 60-120 meteors per hour. This unique shower, originating from asteroid 3200 Phaethon, offers a prime opportunity for unforgettable cosmic viewing.

title: Cardi B shares sweet glimpse of newborn son, calls him her ‘cuddle buddy’
content: Cardi B is embracing motherhood again, sharing tender moments with her newborn son and boyfriend Stefon Diggs on Instagram. The rapper also offered glimpses of her other children, Kulture, Wave, and Blossom, highlighting the joys and realities of family life. This new chapter signifies personal growth and a continued commitment to her artistic career.

title: Warriors linked to $27M Mavericks star as support for Curry; Hield seen as key asset
content: Golden State Warriors and Dallas Mavericks are reportedly considering a straightforward trade: Buddy Hield for Naji Marshall. This move addresses roster imbalances, with the Warriors seeking defensive wing depth and the Mavericks aiming to boost floor spacing around their stars. Both teams could benefit from a fresh start and improved team dynamics.

title: MLB trade rumors: Cubs poised to land $400M Tigers Cy Young winner in mega deal
content: The Chicago Cubs are reportedly considering a blockbuster trade for Detroit Tigers ace Tarik Skubal, a two-time Cy Young winner, to fill the void left by Kyle Tucker's expected free agency departure. This move would create a formidable pitching duo with rookie Cade Horton and signal a serious World Series push for the Cubs.

title: 'Mentally unstable man': Ex-Pak PM Imran Khan fires sharp salvo at Asim Munir
content: Imran Khan, from jail, launched a scathing attack on Pakistan's army chief, Asim Munir, calling him "mentally unstable" and accusing him of disastrous policies that fuel terrorism and ignite tensions with Afghanistan. Khan alleged Munir prioritizes pleasing Western powers over national interests, leading to constitutional collapse and fabricated cases against him and his wife.

title: Rupee hits another low! Currency slumps to 90.43 against US dollar; what it means
content: The Indian rupee hit a record low of 90.43 against the US dollar, marking its fastest decline in under a year. This depreciation is driven by foreign portfolio investment withdrawals, trade deficits, and a strong dollar, despite RBI interventions. However, the government remains optimistic about currency improvement and foreign direct investment inflows next year.

title: 'Why ask me?': Priyanka Vadra on rupee; brings up PM Modi's past remark on Manmohan Singh
content: Congress MP Priyanka Gandhi Vadra deflected questions on the rupee breaching the 90 mark against the US dollar, urging reporters to ask Prime Minister Narendra Modi about his 2013 remarks on the falling rupee. Meanwhile, Chief Economic Adviser V. Anantha Nageswaran stated the government is not concerned about the currency's decline, as it is not impacting inflation or exports.

title: International Cheetah Day: PM Modi celebrates 'one of the planet's most remarkable creatures' — see pics
content: On International Cheetah Day, Prime Minister Narendra Modi took to social media, showcasing heartwarming images and celebrating the remarkable achievements of Project Cheetah. This visionary initiative, active for three years now, is dedicated to revitalizing India's ecological landscape by reintroducing cheetahs to Kuno National Park.

title: 'Kill all' manifesto: How Pak immigrant planned a University of Delaware attack — details
content: A University of Delaware student, Luqmaan Khan, was arrested with a cache of weapons, body armor, and a manifesto detailing plans for a mass shooting and seeking "martyrdom." Police found the arsenal in his truck and later at his home, including an illegal automatic weapon. Khan allegedly expressed a desire to become a martyr.

title: Which grapes are healthiest green black or red and why
content: Grapes, a globally cherished fruit, offer a wealth of nutrients including vitamins, minerals, fibre, and antioxidants. While all varieties are beneficial, black and red grapes boast higher antioxidant levels like resveratrol, supporting heart health and reducing inflammation. Green grapes excel in hydration and vitamin content, making a varied intake ideal for overall well-being.

title: Stock market today: Nifty50 opens below 26,000; BSE Sensex down around 100 points
content: Stock market today: Indian equity benchmark indices, Nifty50 and BSE Sensex, opened in red on Thursday. While Nifty50 was below 26,000, BSE Sensex was down nearly 100 points.

title: IndiGo chaos: What led to cancellation of over 200 flights; fares touching Rs 43,000
content: IndiGo is experiencing significant flight turmoil, impacting hundreds of thousands of travelers due to over 200 cancelled flights and delays reaching up to 10 hours. The airline attributes these challenges to a shortage of pilots and new operational rules. As travel peaks, aviation regulators have called upon IndiGo's leadership to address the chaos and outline a recovery strategy.

title: IND vs SA: 'I'm kicking myself' - Rahul reveals 'real' reasons behind India's shock defeat
content: India captain KL Rahul attributed their four-wicket ODI loss to South Africa to the toss and heavy dew, despite a massive 358/5 powered by centuries from Kohli and Gaikwad. South Africa's record chase of 362/6 was lauded by skipper Temba Bavuma, who highlighted tactical decisions and internal competition as key factors in their victory.

title: Loss-making PIA on block: Pak moves to sell national carrier; previous bid failed
content: Pakistan is set to auction its state-owned airline, PIA, on December 23rd as part of a crucial IMF program. This privatization aims to revive the struggling carrier, restore its global flight operations, and meet modern aviation standards. Prime Minister Sharif emphasized transparency in the bidding process, which, if successful, will be Pakistan's first major privatization in two decades.

title: IND vs SA: 'If Pak have Haris Rauf, India have Prasidh Krishna’ — Pacer draws heavy backlash
content: Prasidh Krishna faced severe online criticism after India's four-wicket loss to South Africa in the second ODI. His expensive spell, conceding 85 runs in 8.2 overs, allowed South Africa to comfortably chase a target of 359. Despite centuries from Kohli and Gaikwad, Markram's 110 led the visitors to a memorable victory, leveling the series.

title: ‘Proof’ in hand, Rajnath stands by claim on Nehru’s Babri plan
content: Defence Minister Rajnath Singh asserted that Jawaharlal Nehru wished to rebuild the Babri Mosque with public funds, citing a book based on Sardar Patel's daughter's diary. Congress vehemently denied this, calling it a fabricated 'WhatsApp university story' and a distraction from pressing national issues. They challenged the minister to provide evidence.

title: Liam Gleason’s cause of death: Siena men’s lacrosse coach dies at 41
content: Siena University mourns the loss of men's lacrosse coach Liam Gleason, 41, who passed away Wednesday following a severe head injury from a home accident. Gleason, who led the Saints to a MAAC title, was a beloved figure in the lacrosse community. His legacy includes building a strong program and deep connections on and off the field.

title: On divorce, Muslim man must return bride parents’ gifts: SC
content: The Supreme Court has made a pivotal ruling that requires bridegrooms to return any financial gifts received from their father-in-law upon divorce, directing that these gifts should revert to the bride. This decision, rooted in addressing patriarchal biases, references the Muslim Women's Act of 1986, designed to safeguard women's dignity and economic stability post-divorce.

title: Top stocks to buy today: Stock market recommendations - check list
content: BofA Securities maintains a neutral stance on PB Fintech, while Jefferies initiates coverage on Chalet Hotels with a buy rating. CLSA upgrades Hindalco with a higher target price, and Citigroup moves HDFC AM to neutral. Macquarie reiterates an outperform rating on ITC, citing potential tailwinds.

title: Putin to begin India visit today with PM Modi’s private dinner; trade in focus
content: President Vladimir Putin's much-anticipated visit to India begins with a private dinner with Prime Minister Narendra Modi, marking the start of discussions focused on enhancing economic collaboration and strategic partnerships. The leaders will also tackle significant global concerns, particularly India's call for resolving the Russia-Ukraine crisis through diplomatic channels.

title: Rupee falls below 90/$ 1st time as US tariffs, FII flows take toll
content: The Indian rupee plunged to a historic low of 90.29 against the US dollar, breaching the 90 mark for the first time. This sharp decline, attributed to US tariffs and significant foreign investor outflows, is now impacting the broader economy. While a weaker rupee makes imports costlier, it could benefit exporters and help manage the current account deficit.

title: Candace Owens faces backlash for sharing private Charlie Kirk stories upsetting widow
content: Candace Owens is facing widespread anger online. A podcast clip featuring her discussing the late Charlie Kirk's past relationships has gone viral. Many believe Owens' comments have deeply hurt Charlie Kirk's widow, Erika, who is still grieving. The public is questioning the timing and intent behind sharing such personal memories.

title: Viral moment! Rohit Sharma makes a wish after Rishabh Pant spots fallen eyelash - WATCH
content: A heartwarming moment saw Rishabh Pant remove an eyelash from Rohit Sharma's face before India's impressive 358/5 in the second ODI. Virat Kohli's 53rd century and Ruturaj Gaikwad's maiden ton powered the score. Rohit also unveiled India's new T20I jersey, expressing confidence for the 2026 World Cup.

title: Centre agrees to bring back Sunali, son from Bangladesh
content: In a humanitarian move, the Indian government will bring back a pregnant Bangladeshi national, Sunali Khatun, and her son after their deportation. The Supreme Court, emphasizing humanity over law, directed the Centre to send Sunali to her father in West Bengal for care. The court also raised questions about her citizenship based on her father's status.

title: 'Tere Ishk Mein' collection: Dhanush and Kriti Sanon's movie crosses Rs 100 crore
content: Dhanush and Kriti Sanon's 'Tere Ishk Mein' experienced a mid-week dip, earning Rs 6.75 crore on Wednesday. Despite this, the film maintains strong domestic hold, especially in metros, and has crossed Rs 100 crore worldwide. This marks Dhanush's biggest Bollywood hit and his first Rs 100 crore global grosser.

title: ‘Anti-labour, pro-crony’ codes pose threat to job security: Kharge
content: Opposition MPs staged a protest against new labour codes, deeming them 'anti-labour' and a threat to job security. Concerns were raised about relaxed layoff thresholds, potential erosion of permanent jobs through contract hiring, and restrictions on striking. Leaders criticized the government's move as favoring corporations over workers' rights and demanded the codes' immediate rollback.

title: 12 Reds, 3 cops dead as forces push deeper into Bastar; 268 Maoists killed so far in 2025
content: A fierce gun battle on the Dantewada-Bijapur border in Chhattisgarh's Bastar region resulted in the deaths of at least 12 Maoists and three District Reserve Guard personnel. This significant loss for the outlawed group occurred as security forces intensified operations in the region. Weapons were recovered, and the search for more insurgents continues.

title: Chaos At Airports As More IndiGo Flights Cancelled Amid Crew Shortage
content: IndiGo cancelled more flights at various airports across the country as it continued to battle operational disruptions, mainly due to crew shortages, for the third straight day on Thursday.

title: New Zealand Man Swallows $20,000 Faberge Egg, Cops Wait For "Nature To Take Its Course"
content: A New Zealand thief with expensive taste has been arrested after snatching and swallowing a diamond-encrusted green Faberge egg from a high-end jewellery store.

title: Trinamool MLA Humayun Kabir Suspended Over Proposal To Build Babri Mosque Replica
content: Trinamool MLA Humayun Kabir has been suspended from the party after he proposed to build a Babri mosque replica in West Bengal's Murshidabad.

title: Dentist Chair, Masks, Blackboard Scribbles: Inside Epstein's Private Island
content: Epstein owned two islands in the US Virgin Islands: the 70-acre Little St. James, bought in 1998 for $7.95 million, where he built a sprawling estate, and Great Saint James, acquired in 2016.

title: New "Disturbing" Photos And Videos Released Of Epstein's Private Island
content: House Democrats on the Oversight Committee on Wednesday released a batch of photographs and video clips taken on Jeffrey Epstein's private islands in the US Virgin Islands.

title: Bangladesh's Gen-Z Battles To Gain Political Ground After Ousting Sheikh Hasina
content: Thousands in Bangladesh flocked to hear the plans of the students who toppled long-time leader Sheikh Hasina when they launched a new political party this year, but now it finds itself struggling to translate the street power into votes.

title: SIR Reunites Son With Parents After 26 Years In West Bengal
content: The SIR process reunited Prashanta Dutta and his wife, Santona Dutta, with their son, Tarun Dutta, who left home 26 years ago.

title: "Want To Control More People": Marco Rubio Warns Radical Islam A Threat For US
content: US State Secretary Marco Rubio on Wednesday (local time) warned that radical Islam's desire to "control more territories and people" is an "imminent threat" to the world.

title: IndiGo Shares Fall Over 3% Amid Flight Disruptions Due To Crew Shortage
content: InterGlobe Aviation, the parent company of IndiGo, saw its shares fall more than 3 per cent on Thursday as the airline continued to struggle with large-scale flight disruptions across the country.

title: Putin's Aurus Senat Is One Of The Safest Cars In The World: All About It
content: Russian President Vladimir Putin arrives in India today, and with him comes his security convoy, which includes one of the world's most secretive and heavily protected vehicles: the Aurus Senat.

title: Andhra Allots 480 Acres For Adani-Google AI Data Centre In Visakhapatnam
content: Andhra Pradesh government has allotted 480 acres of land in Visakhapatnam and Anakapalli districts to Adani Infra (India) Pvt Ltd, a 'notified partner' of Raiden Infotech India, a Google company, for setting up 1 GW AI Data Centres in the state.

title: Pak-Origin Man Arrested In US With Car Full Of Guns To Carry Out Mass Shooting
content: A Pakistani immigrant has been arrested in the United States for allegedly planning a mass shooting on the school's campus.

title: 29 Poll Booths In Bengal Have 0 Dead, Duplicate Or Shifted Voters
content: As on Monday evening, the Election Commission of India (ECI) identified 2,208 polling booths in West Bengal that did not have a single "dead" voter or "duplicate" voter or "shifted" voter.

title: In Bengal, Poll Body Identifies 3 Booths Without A 'Self' Voter
content: A voter in the ongoing Special Intensive Revision (SIR) by the ECI is considered a "self" if he or she has his or her name in the voters' list for 2002, the base year for the ongoing revision exercise.

title: Prajwal Revanna's Plea To Suspend Life Sentence In Rape Case Rejected
content: A division bench of Justice K S Mudagal and Justice Venkatesh Naik T on Wednesday held that considering the gravity of the offences, multiple cases pending against him, and the risk of witness tampering, this was not a fit case for bail.

title: "'They Safeguard Our Shores": PM Modi's Praise On Navy Day
content: PM Narendra Modi on Thursday extended greetings to all Indian Navy personnel on the occasion of Navy Day, praising the force for its growing self-reliance, steadfast resolve and the valour with which it guards the nation's maritime frontiers.

title: Andhra Cops Find Rs 72 Lakh Cash Inside Inter-State Bus, 2 Arrested
content: The checks were part of statewide inspections launched ahead of Christmas, New Year, and the upcoming local body elections to curb drug trafficking and related illegal activities.

title: 5,000 Members, Online Training, Rs 500 Fee: Jaish Women Wing's Growth Curve
content: Over 5,000 women have been recruited in the terror outfit Jaish-e-Mohammed's newly-launched wing, Jamaat ul Mominaat, and efforts to radicalise them are on, sources in the security establishment suspect

title: Dyson Daniels is top-25 in CAT leagues because steals matter
content: Dyson Daniels is in the top 25 of this week's fantasy basketball roto and category league player rankings . but he is only 75th in the points rankings because of the steals . the player Rater values his steals more than any single player's scoring contributions except for Shai Gilgeous-Alexander and Tyrese Maxey .

title: Rating Portugal kit for Ronaldo's final World Cup, other Puma jerseys
content: 42 of the 48 qualifiers confirmed for 2026 world cup draw . a cavalcade of kits will be released in preparation for the event . the event will be staged in Canada, Mexico and the united states next summer .

title: An All-Star for All-Star swap? MLB trade proposals that would rock the offseason
content: we asked our MLB insiders to give us their preferred destination for some of the biggest names in our ranking of the top 25 MLB offseason trade candidates . the new york Mets are acquiring Marcus Semien from the Texas Rangers for Brandon Nimmo and the Boston Red Sox adding Sonny Gray to their pitching staff .

title: WWE 'Raw' takeaways: Liv Morgan takes over
content: the first "Raw" after Survivor Series began a season that will lead us to WrestleMania in April . the identity of the masked man who interfered at the end of the men's WarGames match wasn't close to being uncovered . neither was the next challenger to the women's tag team titles .

title: Ja, LaMelo and Trae: Why these All-Star guards may have 'negative value'
content: coach: "you feel like you've got the same joy right now that we used to see? no" rumors that ball, Morant and Young could all be available in the trade deadline . a poll of executives, scouts and coaches conducted by ESPN .

title: NCAA women's volleyball tournament: Bold predictions, must-watch players and more
content: all 64 NCAA women's college volleyball tournament teams were finalized Sunday . the undefeated Huskers earned the no. 1 overall seed, led by first-year coach Dani Busboom Kelly . Nebraska has lost only seven sets this season as it is on the hunt to add a sixth national championship title to its résumé .

title: All the news, flips and top moments from the early signing day
content: DT Lamar Brown, the no. 1 overall ESPN 300 recruit, explains his decision to not sign yet after verbally committing to LSU earlier this year . college football's early signing period started Wednesday and runs until Friday . if a prospect doesn't sign a national letter of intent by Friday, the next national signing day for this cycle .
